title: Peri-Peri Air Fried Chicken Tenders
directions: Toss raw chicken tenders with 3 tbsp peri-peri sauce, 1 tbsp spicy honey, salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and black pepper.
Let marinate for 15-30 minutes (optional but worth it).
Air fry at 375°F for 10-12 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crispy and cooked through (165°F internal temp).
After cooking, brush lightly with extra peri-peri sauce and drizzle with spicy honey for a glossy, spicy-sweet finish.
notes: Pairs perfectly with rosemary red potatoes and roasted carrots. The slight sweetness plays off earthy sides beautifully. An alternative sweet and savory route uses 1 tbsp Spicy Honey + 1 tbsp Strawberry Jalapeno Jam + a dash of balsamic fig vinegar as a glaze brushed on after air frying. Skip Red Pepper Almond Pesto and Pomegranate Fermented Pepper for this dish - they work better as dips or pasta sauces.
